AssociateUser.name: AssociateUser
AssociateUser.documentation:
Associates the user to an EC2 instance to utilize user-based subscriptions.

Your estimated bill for charges on the number of users and related costs will take 48 hours to appear for billing periods that haven't closed (marked as Pending billing status) in Amazon Web Services Billing. For more information, see Viewing your monthly charges in the Amazon Web Services Billing User Guide.

DeregisterIdentityProvider.name: DeregisterIdentityProvider
DeregisterIdentityProvider.documentation: Deregisters the identity provider from providing user-based subscriptions.

DisassociateUser.name: DisassociateUser
DisassociateUser.documentation: Disassociates the user from an EC2 instance providing user-based subscriptions.

ListIdentityProviders.name: ListIdentityProviders
ListIdentityProviders.documentation: Lists the identity providers for user-based subscriptions.

ListInstances.name: ListInstances
ListInstances.documentation: Lists the EC2 instances providing user-based subscriptions.

ListProductSubscriptions.name: ListProductSubscriptions
ListProductSubscriptions.documentation: Lists the user-based subscription products available from an identity provider.

ListUserAssociations.name: ListUserAssociations
ListUserAssociations.documentation: Lists user associations for an identity provider.

RegisterIdentityProvider.name: RegisterIdentityProvider
RegisterIdentityProvider.documentation: Registers an identity provider for user-based subscriptions.

StartProductSubscription.name: StartProductSubscription
StartProductSubscription.documentation:
Starts a product subscription for a user with the specified identity provider.

Your estimated bill for charges on the number of users and related costs will take 48 hours to appear for billing periods that haven't closed (marked as Pending billing status) in Amazon Web Services Billing. For more information, see Viewing your monthly charges in the Amazon Web Services Billing User Guide.

StopProductSubscription.name: StopProductSubscription
StopProductSubscription.documentation: Stops a product subscription for a user with the specified identity provider.

UpdateIdentityProviderSettings.name: UpdateIdentityProviderSettings
UpdateIdentityProviderSettings.documentation: Updates additional product configuration settings for the registered identity provider.

AccessDeniedException.documentation: You don't have sufficient access to perform this action.

DirectoryId.documentation: The directory ID for an Active Directory identity provider.

ActiveDirectoryIdentityProvider.documentation: Details about an Active Directory identity provider.

InstanceId.documentation: The ID of the EC2 instance, which provides user-based subscriptions.

Username.documentation: The user name from the identity provider for the user.

InstanceUserSummary.documentation: Metadata that describes the associate user operation.

ConflictException.documentation: The request couldn't be completed because it conflicted with the current state of the resource.

Attribute.documentation: The name of an attribute to use as a filter.

Filter.documentation: A filter name and value pair that is used to return more specific results from a describe operation. Filters can be used to match a set of resources by specific criteria, such as tags, attributes, or IDs.

FailureMessage.documentation: The failure message associated with an identity provider.

Product.documentation: The name of the user-based subscription product.

LastStatusCheckDate.documentation: The date of the last status check.

Products.documentation: A list of provided user-based subscription products.

Status.documentation: The status of an EC2 instance resource.

StatusMessage.documentation: The status message for an EC2 instance.

InstanceSummary.documentation: Describes an EC2 instance providing user-based subscriptions.

AssociationDate.documentation: The date a user was associated with an EC2 instance.

DisassociationDate.documentation: The date a user was disassociated from an EC2 instance.

Status.documentation: The status of a product for a user.

Username.documentation: The user name from the identity provider of the user.

ServiceQuotaExceededException.documentation: The request failed because a service quota is exceeded.

SecurityGroupId.documentation: A security group ID that allows inbound TCP port 1688 communication between resources in your VPC and the VPC endpoint for activation servers.

Subnets.documentation: The subnets defined for the registered identity provider.

Settings.documentation: The registered identity provider’s product related configuration settings such as the subnets to provision VPC endpoints, and the security group ID that is associated with the VPC endpoints. The security group should permit inbound TCP port 1688 communication from resources in the VPC.

ThrottlingException.documentation: The request was denied because of request throttling. Retry the request.

Product.documentation: The name of the user-based subscription product.

UpdateSettings.documentation:
Updates the registered identity provider’s product related configuration settings. You can update any combination of settings in a single operation such as the:

  • Subnets which you want to add to provision VPC endpoints.

  • Subnets which you want to remove the VPC endpoints from.

  • Security group ID which permits traffic to the VPC endpoints.

AddSubnets.documentation: The ID of one or more subnets in which License Manager will create a VPC endpoint for products that require connectivity to activation servers.

RemoveSubnets.documentation: The ID of one or more subnets to remove.

SecurityGroupId.documentation: A security group ID that allows inbound TCP port 1688 communication between resources in your VPC and the VPC endpoints for activation servers.

UpdateSettings.documentation: Updates the registered identity provider’s product related configuration settings such as the subnets to provision VPC endpoints.

documentation: With License Manager, you can create user-based subscriptions to utilize licensed software with a per user subscription fee on Amazon EC2 instances.
